title: How to Make a Game Like RuneScape

steps.headline: Figure out what you want in your game, make a list with things you really want in your game and put it in a locker until you reach a specific step beneath.
Download 3Ds max or buy it (pretty expensive, but do you want new handful updates?
steps.description: Buy it and you support autodesk) and follow the tutorials. 3Ds max is a very difficult program, but it is used for animations like "Finding Nemo". What you do in 3DS max is you create the models/characters used in the game and so now create a simple character, save it, create an environment, save that, make a turret (enemy that shoots frequently at you, could be an archer/cannon/guy with guns) and save that (all those files should be saved separately).

steps.headline: Download/buy unity 3D, (this is your engine,) and again follow many tutorials.
steps.description: Create a new scene where you separately load the 3 files and put them together, with a few scripting learned by the tutorials the turret shoots at the character you can steer and attack back.

steps.headline: Make a whole world and enemies.
steps.description: This is also the time to pick up your list and scratch things and add them to your game.

steps.headline: Use music software (like fruity loops) to make specific soundtrack.
steps.description: Music could be very important. Do not forget to make trigger sounds like gun sound, walking or shouting.

steps.headline: Search for a server and create your own website.
steps.description: Do this by making it attractive so you can pay your server payments back with "google ads".

steps.headline: Let your game be free.
steps.description: Add attractive extras which the gamers may buy so you can have your profit. Promote your game!
